events.event_name: Record US natural gas storage withdrawal
events.description: A record 360 Bcf withdrawal from US underground natural gas storage was reported for the previous week.
Extreme cold weather event in the previous week that drove high heating demand.
Natural gas production in the Lower 48 states began to recover in early February.

facts.fact_text: US natural gas futures were priced around $3.50 per MMBtu on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: US natural gas futures were little changed around $3.50 per MMBtu on Friday

facts.fact_text: Natural gas futures are down nearly 20% for the week.

evidences.evidence_text: are on track to end the week down nearly 20%

facts.fact_text: US underground natural gas storage saw a record 360 Bcf withdrawal last week.

evidences.evidence_text: Traders assessed a record 360 Bcf withdrawal from US underground natural gas storage last week

facts.fact_text: Natural gas inventories are 27 Bcf below the five-year average.

evidences.evidence_text: left inventories 27 Bcf below the five-year average

facts.fact_text: Lower 48 natural gas output rose to approximately 106.6 bcfd in early February.

evidences.evidence_text: Lower 48 output rising to around 106.6 bcfd in early February from January levels

claims.claim_text: Mid-February weather forecasts have shifted to significantly warmer temperatures.
claims.author: Weather forecasts

evidences.evidence_text: mid-February weather forecasts have shifted markedly warmer particularly across the northeastern US

claims.claim_text: Warmer weather is expected to decrease the demand for heating.

evidences.evidence_text: reducing expected heating demand following last week’s Arctic blast

evidence.evidence_text: mid-February weather forecasts have shifted markedly warmer... reducing expected heating demand
reducing expected heating demand following last week’s Arctic blast
Meanwhile, production has begun to recover... US natural gas futures were little changed
withdrawal from US underground natural gas storage last week, which left inventories 27 Bcf below the five-year average
